title: Disney Plus: The Best Movies Coming At Launch
text:
Image: Supplied

On November 19, Disney will officially launch its streaming service, Disney+, as a competitor against other major platforms like Netflix and Amazon Prime Video.

And while we’ve known what to expect from the streaming service for some time, in a series of 300+ tweets, Disney+ revealed its entire lineup of TV and film available on launch day.

Yes, there will be Pixar and Marvel classics like Toy Story and Iron Man, but judging by the response on social media, the most exciting part of the announcement is the huge back catalogue of Disney shows and movies you once loved and cherished like Blank Check, Heavyweights, and the Lizzie McGuire show (and movie).

While our friends at Gizmodo have compiled the absurdly long list of movies and TV shows as part of the announcement, who is actually looking forward to streaming the very mediocre sequel to Twitches?

Instead, defer to our list of the best — and we mean best — film and TV coming to Disney+, beginning with some classics (and then followed by some Lifehacker staff favourites.)

Note: Disney Australia has not announced its Disney Plus library yet. While it is expected to be very similar, preexisting licensing agreements may keep some of these titles off the Australian service; if only for a few months.

The classics

101 Dalmations

20,000 Leagues Under the Sea

Aladdin

Alice in Wonderland

The Aristocats

Bambi

Cinderella

Dumbo

Escape to Witch Mountain

A Goofy Movie

Honey, I Shrunk the Kids

Journey to the Centre of the Earth

The Jungle Book

Lady and the Tramp

Little Mermaid

The Lion King

Mary Poppins

Miracle on 34th Street

The Muppet Movie

Newsies

Old Yeller

Peter Pan

Pochahontas

Pollyanna

Robin Hood

The Sound of Music

Tron

Turner & Hooch

Who Framed Roger Rabbit

Our favourites

Blank Check

Brink!

The Cheetah Girls

Double Teamed

Even Stevens

Halloweentown

Heavyweights

Hocus Pocus

Johnny Tsunami

Kazaam

Lizzie McGuire

The Luck of the Irish

Mum’s Got a Date with a Vampire

Motocrossed

Mulan

The Parent Trap

Phantom of the Megaplex

Recess

Rip Girls

The Sandlot

Smart House

Smart Guy

Sister Act

Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit

Spider-Man: Unlimited

The Thirteenth Year

Zenon: Girl of the 21st Century

If you want to sign up for Disney+, head over to their website; streaming will cost $8.99 a month (or $89.99 for a year).

And nothing for Boy Meets World, bye.
description: On November 19, Disney will officially launch its streaming service, Disney+, as a competitor against other major platforms like Netflix and Amazon Prime Video....
